Bring your own bag when shopping
How many times do you want to do this habit?

string-array.name: habits_desc
string-array.item: Avoid using single-use plastic bags by bringing your own reusable bag when shopping.
Opt for cycling instead of driving for short trips.
Cut back on unnecessary purchases and adopt a more sustainable, minimalist approach to shopping.
Eat less meat, especially beef and lamb.
Purchase food that is locally grown and organic to support sustainable agriculture.
Take buses, trains, or subways instead of driving.
Recycle paper, plastics, and metals to help reduce waste in landfills.
Power down electronics and appliances when not in use to save energy.
Walk instead of driving or using public transportation for short distances.
Use cold water for laundry instead of hot water to save energy.

string-array.name: habits_impact_desc
string-array.item: Impact: Low — Reduces plastic waste and the energy used in manufacturing and transporting plastic bags.
Impact: High — Replacing car trips with cycling can drastically reduce CO2 emissions and air pollution.
Impact: Medium — By reducing demand for products, it lowers emissions from manufacturing, packaging, and transportation.
Impact: High — Reducing meat consumption, especially red meat, can significantly lower methane emissions from livestock farming.
Impact: Medium — Reduces emissions from transportation and fertilizers.
Impact: High — Public transport is one of the most effective ways to reduce CO2 emissions from personal vehicles.
Impact: Medium — Recycling conserves energy and raw materials.
Impact: Low — A relative easy way to reduce energy consumption.
Impact: High — Walking eliminates emissions entirely for short trips, making it an effective low-carbon transportation option.
Impact: Medium — Reducing energy used for heating water can lower emissions especially if you do laundry often.
